column1: Kasba Tadla (Arabic: قصبة تادلة‎, romanized: Qaṣba Tadla; Berber: ⴰⵢⵜ ⵎⵍⵍⴰⵍ) is a town in Béni-Mellal Province, Béni Mellal-Khénifra, Morocco. According to the 2004 census it has a population of 40,898.
Tadla is an Amazigh name means bouquet of wheat.
The city was taken by the Banu Ifren the early eleventh century. The city fell to the Almoravids thereafter to 1068.
